text:
It was last week and I still remember like it was yesterday. I was so concerned that I couldn't sleep for a whole week! And I will tell you what happened. It was Christmas morning. I woke up with my big brother, Roy. And I found out that we are not in our beds, we was in middle of a big garden! And I noticed that snows are falling. I looked at my brother. Then I realized that he was dealicious-looking choco-chip icecream! "Roy," I continued, "You are a icecream!" "So are you, Max!" he said. I looked down at my body. "Hey, I'm not icecream, I am a snowman!" l said. "That's what I wanted to say." he said. "But..." I wanted to say something mean to him, but he snapped. "No, no, no, there's no time to fight against each other. We have to find out what's going on first." I felt a little annoyed, but I didn't blame him because he was my big brother.

"Let's look around for a clue." he said, and we looked and searched behind bushes and trees, but nothing was founded. And we searched like that for a couple of hours. "I think we are going to die! We are still in early civilization! I don't want to die when I am still eleven! Ohhh, I miss my home and my parents!" I shouted, and I really didn't haved hope then. "No, don't lose your hope, it's too early to forgive, we have to try, tough." he ducked down as he comforted me. "And don't be hopeless all day long, you could find your hope right behind you." as he continued, he pull out a long, blue bottle that was embedded in the ground. "Like now, I found a new clue to investigate."
"Hmm..." he said. "Hmmm..." he continued, "Hmmmmmmm..." he looked very closely and carefully like he was trying to see what was in the blue bottle. Finally, he gripped, turned, and opend the bottle's lid. And slowly, very slowly, he grasped a thing that was in the bottle.
Then he carefully taked a piece of the old paper out of the bottle. It was scrolled, so my brother had to slid open the scroll.
"What do it say?" I said. "Okay, I will tell you." he said;

The sun rises, and the snowmans won't melt
Go to four places that will give you the clue;
The Christmas tree, Santa's sleigh, The Solvers' Forest, and last for all, The Snowing tree will help you save your lives

"That's it?" I said. "Yes." he answered. "Where's all the places we need?"I said. "I don't know? And why are you keep asking things that nobody knows to me?" he said, but I ignored him. "Hey, I just got an idea." I said. "Flip it upside down."
He flipped it. And who guessed what was drawed there? A map that leads to the four places! "Good job, Max! You found the map!"

"So," my brother said, "let's split up. I will rip the map in half. I will go to the Snowing tree, and the Solvers' forest, you go to the Santa's sleigh and the Christsmas tree, Okay?" And then, just as he said, he ripped the map in half. "Here." he gave me the piece of the map to me. "And good luck!" and we splited up. First, I will tell you what happened to me gecause I am the hero of this story.
I went to the Santa's sleigh first. "Ther is no Santa on Santa's sleigh, is this possible?" I said when I arrived at the Santa's sleigh.
"Actualy, can this move?" I said in suggestion. "I heard that if somone got a Santa's present, you can have anything you want."
"Then, when I steal this, I can get something that will be the solution of our problem, right? Steal, wait? This is the real problem." I said.
"I doubt my kind personality!" I said as wait for something to happen.
After a couple hours of waiting, finally, someone or something came beside the sleigh. I turned around to see who was coming.
And guess who came? Santa! I greeted him with a short delight. Then, I told him what happened to me and my brother when we woke up in the morning.
"Hoooo hooo hooo! If that is your problem, I will give you the solution a bit beacause I don't know exactly how to slove your problem." he said. Then he reached to his sleigh and gripped something I don't know yet. And with a small "Snap!", he held out a weird-looking plant and gave it to me. "What's that?" I asked. "It's a precious plant that only grows on my sleigh. I don't know exactly as I told you, but I think that it will help you and your brother anyway." he answered. Then I said goodbye and went to the next place to save our lives.
Next, I will tell you what happened to my brother when I was dealing with the Santa.

"This is the Snowing tree?" my brother said. "It's big, but I don't think it is different from the other trees except the big snow decorations dangling from the branches." he said. Suddenly, a voice boomed from the ceiling; "IT'S NOT DECORATIONS, IT IS A REAL SNOW WITH MAGICAL POWERS!" "Whaaaat.... what was that?" he said with fear. "IT'S ME, THE TREE!" The Snowing tree boomed again. "Aha! Um...and sorry for teasing you, sir." he said. "That's okay, I don't mind." it said. "And you are a talking-snowman, that's more interesting!" it said.
"Yes, I have a problem, sir. I turned in to a snowman this morning when I woke. Can you solve this problem, sir?" he said.
"Hmmm.... I think you're caught a spell, a poweful one." he said as he thoughtfully moved and scratched its head.
"I was once a human, so I now the solution. I will give you this." he said as he picked an enormous icicle with its branches.
He gaved the huge icicle to him. "It's too heavy, sir how do I....." he said as he get the icicle. "Wait a sec." it sanpped. And few seconds later, the icicle's size sinked to his hand's size. "And how's that? It's now something your hand's size!" it chuckled. And he said thak you to the Snowing tree and off he went to the Solver's forest.
And now I will tell continue my story.
I went to the next place, the Christmas tree. 'It was absolutely no life around here except me and this tree and some annoying bugs buzzing around here.' I thought. I looked around, suspiciously. And suddenly, I caught a small voice whispering: "#(;!
I looked closely where the voice came from( The Christmas tree). And, I saw, two buzzing little fairies talking to each other!
I gasped. But, even though I was scared, I decided to ask the fairies for solution.

"I have a problem, fairies, I woke and noticed I was a snowman! Do you have some solutions?" I cried.
There was a short silence. "&^=(* I heard them whispering. I don't know what they where talking about, but I do know one thing; fairies can't speak English! I sighed. Maybe it was impossible to go back to human forrm. Wait... there's a way to communicate with the fairies!
I didn't think that this would work, but I would try it out first. I did a cumbersome mime to communicate. Then another, then another. And at last, I did the last pose. I looked at the faries. I think they understood. They looked at me. Or not. Suddenly, all the fairies gathered in one and maked a big fairy that was bigger than me. And they scraped some of the earth beside the tree's roots and gave it to me. I think that this can make the solution. I did a mime that means thank you and took off to the Solver's forest where my brother is trying to get the last solution. 'Yes!' I thought to myself. 'Perfect! One more left!'
Meanwhile, he arrived at the Solver's forest. It was not the appearence he thought. It was dark and gloomy, even it was morning!
"Ahhh, Mr. Forest! Do you have any solution to change my body back to human form?" he said.
There was no answer.
"Hello? Are you there, Mr.?" he said. "This forest was once destroyed by a human guy. But one hopeless sprout grow and grow with gloom to this forest. And you said you were a human, so I can revenge to you for the same animal!" a tree besisde him roared.
But then, when they were talking to each other, I, the hero came for rescue. "I don't know exactly, but I think this is the solution to bring back the bad forest in to a big, cheerful forest." I said. Then I squatted my heels and pulled out a little patch of earth that the fairies gave. "Now!"

I was once a human, so I know the solution. "I will give you this," he said as he picked an enormous icicle with its branches.

I have a problem, fairies. I woke up and noticed that I was a snowman! "Do you have any solutions?" I cried.
There was a short silence. I heard them whispering. I don't know what they were talking about, but I do know one thing: fairies can't speak English! I sighed. Maybe it was impossible to go back to human form. Wait... there's a way to communicate with the fairies!
I didn't think that this would work, but I decided to try it out first. I performed a cumbersome mime to communicate, then another, and another. Finally, I did the last pose and looked at the fairies. I think they understood. They looked at me, or not. Suddenly, all the fairies gathered in one and made a big fairy that was bigger than me. They scraped some of the earth beside the tree's roots and gave it to me. I think that this can provide the solution. I did a mime that means thank you and took off to the Solver's forest where my brother is trying to get the last solution. 'Yes!' I thought to myself. 'Perfect! One more left!'
Meanwhile, he arrived at the Solver's Forest. It was not the appearance he thought. It was dark and gloomy, even though it was morning!
"Ahhh, Mr. Forest! Do you have any solution to change my body back to its human form?" he said.
There was no answer.
"Hello? Are you there, Mr.?" he asked. "This forest was once destroyed by a human. But one hopeless sprout grew and grew in the gloom of this forest. And since you said you were a human, I can take revenge on you for the same reason!" A tree beside him roared.

But then, when they were talking to each other, I, the hero, came to rescue them. "I don't know exactly, but I think this is the solution to turn the bad forest back into a big, cheerful forest," I said. Then, I squatted and pulled out a little patch of earth that the fairies had given me. "Now!"
